data.title: Classic Film Noir Ranked List
data.meta_description: This is our ever-evolving list of all Classic Film Noir Ranked List movies released during the classic era from 1941 through 1964.
data.text: Double Indemnity (1944)1944Foolish insurance man meets one of the best Femme Fatale in this must see drama...A The Big Sleep (1946)1946Detective Philip Marlowe (Humphrey Bogart) is hired by a wealthy client. By the end of the case, there is murder, blackmail, and maybe love…A Nightmare Alley (1947)1947One of the greatest, yet subdued, Femme Fatale, she uses greed instead of sex to drive a man to the lowest depths possible at the end of a Gin bottle…A Sunset Blvd. (1950)1950A young man is murdered after he gets involved with a much older actress...A D.O.A. (1949)1949A "who done it" like you have never seen before…A Ride the Pink Horse (1947)1947Disillusioned WW2 vet arrives in a New Mexico town to blackmail a war racketeer. Imbued with a rare humanity...A Out of the Past (1947)1947The best Femme Fatale ever...A The Harder They Fall (1956)1956This is a gritty boxing Film Noir without a series Femme Fatale. This movie was Humphrey Bogart last film. Rod SteigerA iMDB - I Wake Up Screaming (1941)1941Early crooked cop psycho-noir. Redolent noir motifs, dark shadows, off-kilter framing and expressionist imagery.A iMDB - Touch of Evil (1958)1958Orson Welles directed this masterpieces that starred Charleton Heston as Mexican detective...A The Asphalt Jungle (1950)1950Director John Huston pulls off another Film Noir masterpiece in this gritty heist drama where everything falls apart. Sterling Hayden and Sam Jaffe are amazing. They are supported by James WhitmorA Murder, My Sweet (1944)1944(Aka Farewell, my Lovely). The most noir fun you will ever have. Raymond Chandler prose crackles with moody noir direction from Edward Dmytryk…A The Narrow Margin (1952)1952Set on a train, this is the classic Film Noir featuring Marie Windsor and Charles McGrawA The Killing (1956)1956Sterling Hayden is amazing in the tale of a robbery gone horribly wrong...A Pickup on South Street (1953)1953A very good Film Noir with pickpockets, Feds, and Commies…A Kiss Me Deadly (1955)1955One of the greatest and most stylistic Film Noirs ever made. Based on a Mickey Spillane novel, Kiss Me Deadly (1955) is a thrilling movie.A The Maltese Falcon (1941)1941The best of ALL the Film Noir. Humphrey Bogart is amazing so is everyone else…A iMDB - I Love Trouble (1948)1948C iMDB - Force of Evil (1948)1948Polonsky transcends noir in a tragic allegory on greed and family.
